blockdesc-temporalbutcherbox-*: Temporal powered butcher box configured for meat preservation. Add temporal gears to power.
temporalbutcherbox-hours-left: Hours left till temporal power runs out: {0:D2} Hours
game:butcheringguide-text:
Butchering Guide Introduction This mod is designed to provide more immersive butchering mechanics but in doing so DOES make the game harder. This is done by having to do several steps before you are able to get the resources out of an animal. How do I start butchering animals?
A step by step guide Step 0: You will need these things to start butchering: - Any Knife - Skinning Hook - Butchering Table (The Butchery Tables go into your backback slots and can be placed like a filled skep using ctrl + numbers 1-4 or scrollwheel. The Butchery Tables are 3 blocks wide and will extend 2 blocks to the right of where you place it.) - Optional: Butchering Bag - Optional: Any Cleaver (Cleavers use less durability than knifes when processing the animal on a Butchering Table) Step 1: When you kill a creature, you have two options. Either you cut it open and get only a small fraction of the items from it (for when you are truly desperate) or you right click it and it will be placed in a open bag slot (the four to the right of your hotbar). If you have a Butchering Bag it will be placed in your inventory instead. Step 2: Bring that animal to a place where you have built a Skinning Hook. Right clicking this will place the animal upon the hook from your inventory or bag slot. Step 3: Aiming at the hook, you hold right click with any knife until the creature is skinned. Step 4: Wait for the creature to be bled out (this takes a short while). You will notice the body will change colour to a less red hue when it is done. Step 5: Right click the hook again to take the body down and it will be once again placed into your inventory (if you have a butchery bag) or bag slots Step 6: Place the bled-out body upon a Butchery Table then hold right click with any knife or cleaver. This will butcher the body into its raw bits and leave behind a bone carcass which can be broken for bones.
game:butcheringinfo-text: Butchering Info Drops & Uses: - Sinew (Comes from bushmeat creatures and has to dry before use) Uses: Bows Sewing Kits Sinew Glue - Primemeat (Comes from redmeat creatures and provides high saturation and health) Uses: Meals Prepared Healthy Primemeat Fat Rendering - Offal (Internal organs of a butchered creature that can be used for food recipes after cleaning it in a barrel) Uses: Blood Sausage & Black Pudding - Blood (Can be made used in many food recipes and is harvested by bucket 2-4 blocks bellow a creature going into the bled out stage on the skinning hooks) Uses: Blood Dough (Makes bread and pies) Blood Soup (Replaces water in soup cooking recipe) - Raw Hide Uses: Hide Glue - Bones Uses: Bone Knapping (Can make arrow heads and needles) Modded Mechanics: - Smoking (Food can be smoked by placing a firepit under a Smoking Rack to extend the food's life) - Blood Collection (Blood can be obtained by placing a bucket 2-4 blocks under a bleeding out animal and waiting for the creature to turn to the bled out state) - Animal Mass (Animals bodies now slow you down) Things To Note: - Small creatures such as chickens, hares and foxes can be fit in any inventory slot and don't require placing in the bag slots. - Cleavers use less durability than knifes when butchering animals on the butchering table - Creatures will rot if left too long on the skinning hooks and butchery table. To get rot from them simply place in your crafting menu. - Butchery and smoking is best done in a cellar enviroment. - Butchery bags can be made to provide extra room to carry back dead animals. - The butchery tables go into your backback slots and can be placed like a skep. Secondly they are 3 blocks wide and will extend 2 blocks to the right of where you place it.
